string.name: ingredient1
string.br: - Toppings (honey and peanut butter are our faves)\n

resources.string:
1. Grab a small tupperware box.

2.Spoon 4-5 tablespoons of oats.

3. Add a half-mug of milk and stir into the mix.

4. Chop fruit and add to the mixture.

5. A dollop of honey or peanut butter, or a handful of nuts.

6. Put the lid on and leave in the fridge overnight. 8 hours, ideally.

1.Drop the oats into a blender and whizz until it has a flour-like texture.

2.Add the eggs, banana, protein and baking powder and blend until it’s all smooth.

3.Add the blueberries, raspberries or strawberries.

4.Grab a non-stick frying pan and drop some coconut oil into the pan.

5.Scoop an inch of the mix and drop it into the pan, cooking for one minute on each side.

6.Refrigerate overnight and warm in the morning, with a dollop of peanut butter and/or honey.

string.name: ingredient3
string.br: - ½ cup shredded part-skim mozzarella cheese\n

string.name: method3
string.br: 1. Mix the turkey,2 tablespoons marinara sauce, garlic, cheese, oregano, thyme, salt, pepper, and red pepper flakes together in a large bowl.\n
3. Heat the oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium high heat and add the patties.\n
4. Cook for 4 to 5 minutes, then flip and cook for another 4 to 5 minutes until cooked to 165 degrees Fahrenheit.\n
5. During the last minute of cooking, add 2 tablespoons shredded cheese on top of each burger and cover the skillet to melt the cheese.\n
6. To serve, place the patties on toasted hamburger buns. Top each patty with 1 tablespoon marinara sauce and a few basil leaves. \n
7. Add the bun top and serve!

string.name: ingredient4
string.br: - ½ cup loosely packed sun-dried tomatoes, chopped*\n
- 3 cups plain low fat Greek yogurt\n
- 1 cup sliced California black ripe olives\n

string.name: method4
string.br: 1. Combine quinoa, cucumber, sun-dried tomatoes, red wine vinegar, parsley, and salt. Mix well and set aside.\n
2. In a separate bowl, mix yogurt with minced garlic.\n
3. In a tall round goblet or parfait cup, layer about ⅓ cup yogurt, then 2 tablespoons of sliced black olives and then ½ cup quinoa mixture.\n
4. Repeat with another ⅓ cup of yogurt. Then top with 2 more tablespoons of black olives.\n
5. Lastly, sprinkle top with a tablespoon of chopped walnuts.\n
6. Refrigerate if not eating right away.\n

string.name: method5
string.br: 1.Place a saucepan over a medium heat\n
2.add the peri-peri sauce and garlic powder cook for 2 minutes\n
3.add butter and salt and cook for a further 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.\n
4.Remove from the heat and allow to cool for a few minutes.\n
5.Chop celery, tomatoes and pepper into bite-size pieces.\n
6.shred the chicken using two forks. Place into a large mixing bowl with the cooked pasta.\n
7.Pour over buffalo sauce and toss it through the pasta salad.\n
8.Divide amongst 3 meal-prep containers and drizzle a little ranch dressing over each\n
9.Serve with a handful of mixed leaves or your favourite side salad.\n
10.Refrigerate for up to 3 days and enjoy hot or cold.\n

string.name: method6
string.br: 1.Prepare the seasoning by mixing the fresh thyme, mixed herbs, salt, and pepper in a little bowl.\n
2.Sprinkle generously over your chicken thighs, making sure to coat evenly.\n
3.Keep any remaining seasoning to the side to use later.\n
4.Add the oil to a large pan over a medium heat. Once hot, add your chicken thighs and cook for several minutes on each side.\n
5.They should be crispy and browned on the outside, and completely cooked through on the inside (with no pink bits).\n
6.Remove the chicken from the pan and set aside.\n
7.In the same pan as you cooked the chicken, add the onion and garlic and cook for a few minutes until softened.\n
8.Then add the lemon juice, chicken stock, and any of the remaining seasoning mix, stir well to combine, and allow to bubble for a few minutes.\n
9.Add the crème fraiche, stir through, and cook for another 2-3 minutes to thicken.\n
10.Then add the chicken thighs back into the pan and allow to heat up for a few minutes.\n
11.Remove from the heat and garnish with fresh lemon slices and a sprinkle of thyme.\n
12.Serve up with quinoa and enjoy immediately.\n
